snippet: Vilma Oleri, whose mother, Florence Genova, 91, died on the first day of a major traffic jam in Fort Lee, N.J., said, “I honestly believe it was just her time.”
abstract: Daughter of Florence Genova, 91-year-old woman who died on day of Fort Lee, NJ, traffic jam linked to Gov Chris Christie's administration, says she does not believe inability of ambulance to reach her mother's house was factor in her death; Fort Lee emergency official has said that the traffic jam prevented an ambulance from Englewood Hospital from reaching Genova's home.
lead_paragraph: Vilma Oleri, whose mother, Florence Genova, 91, died on the first day of a major traffic jam in Fort Lee, N.J., said, “I honestly believe it was just her time.”

headline.main: Woman Says Lane Closings Were Not to Blame for Her Mother’s Death
headline.print_headline: Don’t Blame Traffic Jam For Death, Family Says
